intro: Beilschmiedia tarairi, commonly known as the Tarairi beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the lowland rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers followed by dark purple berries, which are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forest regrowth. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
